Zogres are zombified ogres who have invaded the dance site of Jiggig, south of Castle Wars. They are encountered during the Zogre Flesh Eaters quest. Their name is a portmanteau of "zombie" and "ogre". They count as both zombies and ogres for slayer tasks.

When burying zogre bones inside Jiggig, there is a chance that an aggressive skogre will spawn next to the player.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Jiggig ground level56None7Maplink
Jiggig middle level56None23Maplink
Jiggig bottom level56None4Maplink

Strengths and weaknesses[edit | edit source]

Zogres take heavily reduced damage from normal weapons (approximately 75% reduction). Like skogres, they are especially weak to brutal arrows, taking full damage. They also take full damage from poison and familiars. Necromancy is very effective against Zogres.

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.
Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 17 April 2023 (Update):
    • Fixed the issue of incorrect souls being captured by Ushabti.
  • patch 11 April 2023 (Update):
    • Updated Undead Slayer categories gamewide.
  • patch 10 August 2020 (Update):
    • It is no longer possible to spawn extra skogres when burying zogre bones in an area with multiple zogres.
  • patch 7 March 2016 (Update):
    • Zogres have had their combat stats rebalanced.
  • update 17 May 2005 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The zogre playing the drums can be attacked, but only with Ranged, Magic or the use of Melee weapons capable of hitting 2 squares away. You will also need to telegrab their items, should you wish to pick them up.
  • The colour of the drums that the drumming zogre plays is slightly lighter than that of the other drums.
  • Zogres used to inflict disease, but this status effect was removed from the game with the introduction of the Evolution of Combat.
  • According to Juna, zombie ogres fought for Zamorak during the God Wars and could "repel the forces of Saradomin with their stench alone."[1]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Juna, "Tears of Guthix and Zogre Flesh Eaters", RuneScape. "Zombie Ogres!? Some of the foulest creatures of Zamorak. In the great wars, the zogre armies would repel the forces of Saradomin with their stench alone."
